item.title: The Fatal Flaw of Ownership Semantics
item.description: I have been toying with a theoretical idea for the past 18 months off-and-on in my head and I have not fully articulated it aloud yet. It is regarding the concept of Ownership Semantics (OS) or Move Semantics in programming languages. Fundamentally this article is a criticism of the concept and states that the concept is a duality of traditional OOP but applied to a different area. General Definitions of Terminology A general list of definitions of terminology used within this article in order to minimize confusion.
